seniority_level.evidence: Title explicitly states 'Senior Data Engineer II' and requires 5+ years of experience, aligning with senior level in IC hierarchy

job_family.evidence: Job title is 'Senior Data Engineer II' and core responsibilities focus on building data pipelines, ETL, and ML deployment

sub_specialty.evidence: Heavy emphasis on deploying ML pipelines using SageMaker/Vertex AI and productionizing ML workflows, with bonus points for real-time systems

leadership_expectation.evidence: Explicitly mentions mentoring junior engineers, code reviews, and technical leadership through documentation and monitoring, but no mention of direct reports

primary_cloud.evidence: SageMaker (AWS service) is explicitly mentioned as a required skill, and AWS is the only cloud platform referenced

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud platforms (Azure, GCP) are mentioned in the job posting or Pass 1 extraction

processing_paradigm.evidence: Explicitly mentions both 'real-time and batch data integrations' and 'reverse ETL workflows', indicating both streaming and batch processing

orchestrator_category.evidence: DBT is listed as a required skill, and reverse ETL workflows (often orchestrated with dbt) are mentioned

storage_layer.evidence: Redshift and PostgreSQL are listed as required skills, indicating a focus on analytical data warehouses rather than raw data lakes

remote_restriction.evidence: Explicitly states 'Registered States' with 28 US states listed, and 'ActBlue is unable to sponsor work visas', indicating US-only restriction

timezone_focus.evidence: Requires availability during US business hours and mentions distributed teams across all US time zones, indicating Americas focus

relocation_required.evidence: Explicitly states 'remote' work model and lists registered states, implying no relocation required if already in one of those states

h1b_friendly.evidence: Explicitly states 'ActBlue is unable to sponsor work visas at this time' in Pass 1 extraction

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of student visas or OPT/CPT; 'unable to sponsor work visas' implies no support for non-immigrant work authorization

citizenship_required.evidence: States 'unable to sponsor work visas' but does not require US citizenship, implying authorization to work in US is sufficient

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Explicitly states 'full-time, remote, salaried position' and mentions benefits like 401K and health insurance, typical of W2 employees

benefits_level.evidence: Lists unlimited PTO, trans-inclusive health insurance, 401K match, paid parental leave, home-office allowance, and other premium benefits

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'mentor junior engineers' and 'technical leadership' but no explicit career tracks or promotion ladder described

mentorship_signals.evidence: Explicitly mentions 'mentor junior engineers' and 'collaborate with data scientists and ML engineers', implying mentorship opportunities

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotions, advancement, or career progression paths in the job posting

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, lateral moves, or exploring other roles within the company

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit mention of IC, management, specialist, or architect tracks; only general references to technical leadership

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear distinction between 'must have' (Python, data pipelines, SQL) and 'bonus points' (TensorFlow, real-time systems), indicating moderate strictness

scope_definition.evidence: Focused on data engineering with specific responsibilities around pipelines, ML deployment, and data integrations, not a hybrid role

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: 5+ years experience for Senior role is reasonable; skills align with senior data engineer expectations (Python, SQL, cloud ML, ETL)
